answerText: Genoa[10] Genoa was the birthplace of this explorer who sailed for Isabella of Castile and Ferdinand of Aragon. He led four expeditions to the West Indies and was eventually appointed Governor of Hispaniola.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | MIT A  | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This city allied with the Byzantine empire with the 1261 Treaty of Ninfeo. For 10 points each: [10] Name this victor at Meloria and Curzola. One family from this city had a member murdered by the Fieschi family and one who commanded a fleet at Lepanto.
